FuncDef:
The e1 unframed command configures the E1 channel of a CPOS interface to work in clear channel mode and creates a 2.048 Mbit/s synchronous serial interface.
The undo e1 unframed command deletes the synchronous serial interface formed by an E1 channel that works in clear channel mode.
By default, no synchronous serial interface is created on the CPOS interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the E1 channel number of a CPOS interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 63.

ExtraInfo: To configure an E1 channel to work in clear channel mode, run the e1 unframed command. After the command is run, the E1 channel does not contain frame control information and cannot be divided into timeslots or perform timeslot bundling. Instead, it is used as a 2.048 Mbit/s synchronous serial interface
